about.description: QUBEKit is a Python based force field parameter derivation toolkit. Our aims are to allow users to quickly derive molecular mechanics parameters directly from quantum mechanical calculations.
about.summary: Quantum mechanical bespoke force field derivation toolkit

name: qubekit
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "qubekit" %}
{% set version = "2.0.0" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/qubekit/QUBEKit/archive/v.{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 61b940d34e74315da58fed624a134a4d39454c2cf21059b01b00f2aa71c0fed8


build:
  entry_points:
    - QUBEKit = QUBEKit.run:main
    - qubekit = QUBEKit.run:main
    - QUBEKit-pro = QUBEKit.proteins.protein_run:main
    - QUBEKit-gui = QUBEKit.GUI.gui:main
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"

requirements:
  host:
    - python >=3.6
    - pip
  run:
    - python >=3.6
    - numpy >=1.18.1
    - scipy
    - rdkit
    - geometric
    - torsiondrive
    - ambertools
    - networkx >=2.4
    - matplotlib-base
    - qcengine >=0.14.0

test:
  imports:
    - QUBEKit
  requires:
    - rdkit
  commands:
    - QUBEKit -h

about:
  home: https://github.com/qubekit/QUBEKit
  license: MIT
  license_family: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  summary: Quantum mechanical bespoke force field derivation toolkit
  doc_url: https://github.com/qubekit/QUBEKit
  description: QUBEKit is a Python based force field parameter derivation toolkit. Our aims are to allow users to quickly derive molecular mechanics parameters directly from quantum mechanical calculations.
  dev_url: https://github.com/qubekit/QUBEKit

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jthorton
    - CRingrose94
